Solar-powered vehicles: With the advent of solar energy, we can harness the power of the sun to power our vehicles. Solar panels can be installed on the roof of the vehicle to generate electricity to power the motor.

Electric vehicles: Electric vehicles are already gaining popularity as a sustainable alternative to traditional gasoline-powered vehicles. With the disappearance of oil, electric vehicles would become the norm.

Hydrogen fuel cell vehicles: Hydrogen fuel cell vehicles are another alternative to traditional gasoline-powered vehicles. They generate electricity by combining hydrogen and oxygen, producing only water as a byproduct.

Battery-powered vehicles: Battery-powered vehicles are becoming more popular, and with the disappearance of oil, they would become even more practical. They can be charged from an external source, such as a charging station or a wall outlet.

Alternative fuels: There are many alternative fuels that can be used to power vehicles, such as biofuels, natural gas, and coal. With the disappearance of oil, these fuels would become more practical and accessible.
